ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would definitely recommend this class to another student with either a geology, chemistry, biology or environment science background since applications discussed are broad.
I would recommend this course to any geology student interested in geochemistry and any chemistry student interested in a new set of applications for organic chemistry.
Recommend without hesitation. However, if you can't take Mark's direct feedback, you may wish to consider another class.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: This course is directly related to my research area of interest and will likely help me in my minor discourse research. The final was also great practice teaching/explaining science to others which will definitely come in hand for qualifying exams and conference talks.
This course contributed significantly to my future dissertation work.
Working in traditional stable isotopes and organic stable isotopes, this course was a huge step for me towards being mentally adept in those worlds.
